051/**
052 * MakeParallel
053 * Make segments of a way Parallel to each other.
054 *
055 * @author JJWW
056 */
057public class MakeParallelAction extends JosmAction {
058
059
060  @Override
061  protected void updateEnabledState() {
062    //if (getLayerManager().getEditDataSet() == null) {
063    //    setEnabled(false);
064    //} else
065    //    updateEnabledState(getLayerManager().getEditDataSet().getSelected());
066    updateEnabledStateOnCurrentSelection();
067  }
068
069  @Override
070  protected void updateEnabledState(Collection<? extends OsmPrimitive> selection) {
071    if (selection == null) {
072      setEnabled(false);
073      return;
074    }
075    if (selection.size() == 4 ) {
076      setEnabled(true);
077    }
078  }
079
080  public MakeParallelAction() {
081      super(
082              tr("MakeParallel"),
083              "dialogs/logo-makeparallel.png",
084              tr("Make segments parallel"),
085              Shortcut.registerShortcut("menu:makeparallel",
086                      tr("Menu: {0}", tr("MakeParallel")),
087                      KeyEvent.VK_L, Shortcut.NONE),
088              false
089              );
090  }
091
092
093  /** Returns true if the list of nodes form a closed path.
094  * @param nodelist The list of nodes
095  * @return True if closed path
096  */
097  public boolean isClosedPath(List<Node> nodelist) {
098    return nodelist.get(0) == nodelist.get(nodelist.size() - 1);
099  }
100
101  /** Checks if a node is special and should not be deleted.
102  * That is if a node has tags on it or is part of multiple ways
103  * @param node The node
104  * @return True if special
105  */
106  public boolean isSpecialNode(Node node) {
107    boolean special = false;
108
109    if (! node.getKeys().isEmpty()) {
110      Logging.warn("makeparallel: node is special (hasKey) " + node);
111      special = true;
112    }
113     
114    List<Way> w = node.getParentWays();
115    if (w.size() > 1) {
116      Logging.warn("makeparallel: node is special (has multiple parentways) " + node);
117      special = true;
118    }
119
120    return special;
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Called when the action is executed, typically with keyboard shortcut.
125   *
126   * This method looks at what is selected and performs the action
127   */
128  @Override
129  public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
130
131    //Figure out what we have to work with:
132    Collection<OsmPrimitive> selection = getLayerManager().getEditDataSet().getSelected();
133    List<Node> selectedNodes = new ArrayList<>(Utils.filteredCollection(selection, Node.class));
134    // List<Way> selectedWays = new ArrayList<>(Utils.filteredCollection(selection, Way.class));
135
136    List<Node> s1; // source segment on w1
137    List<Node> s2; // destinaton segment on w2
138
139    if (SanityCheck(selectedNodes)) { 
140      s1 = getSegmentFromWay(selectedNodes.get(0), selectedNodes.get(2));
141      s2 = getSegmentFromWay(selectedNodes.get(1), selectedNodes.get(3));
142
143      // Add or remove nodes to segment s2 to match s1
144      if (s1.size() > 3 && s2.size() > 3) {
145        if (addOrRemoveNodesToMatchSegments(s1, s2) ) { // if successfully added/removed nodes
146          double d = calculateDistance(s1, s2);
147          makeSegmentsParallel(s1, s2, d); // Make segment s2 Parallel to s1 at distance d
148        }
149      }
150      else if (s1.size() > 0 && s2.size() > 0) {
151        new Notification(
152           tr("Source segment must be at least 3 nodes long"))
153           .setIcon(JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
154           .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
155           .show();
156         return;
157      }
158    
159    } // if correctly selected nodes
160    
161    MainApplication.getMap().mapView.repaint();
162  }  // actionPerformed()
163
164  /** Checks if the input is as expected.
165  * @param selection The selected nodes.
166  * @return True if input is as expected, false otherwise.
167  */
168  private boolean SanityCheck(List<Node> selection) {
169    if (selection.size() != 4) { // FIXME more sanity checks?
170      new Notification(
171         tr("Please select exactly four nodes on two different ways"))
172         .setIcon(JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
173         .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
174         .show();
175       return false;
176    }
177    else if (selection.get(0).getParentWays().get(0) != selection.get(2).getParentWays().get(0)) {
178      new Notification(
179         tr("First and third selected node must be on same way"))
180         .setIcon(JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
181         .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
182         .show();
183       return false;
184    }
185    else if (selection.get(1).getParentWays().get(0) != selection.get(3).getParentWays().get(0)) {
186      new Notification(
187         tr("Second and fourth selected node must be on same way"))
188         .setIcon(JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
189         .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
190         .show();
191       return false;
192    }
193
194
195    return true;
196  } // SanityCheck 
197
198  /** Traverses the way that node n1 belongs to until it reaches n2 and returns the segment. 
199  * Both nodes should be on the same way. The nodes should have single parent way.
200  * @param n1 the node on the way to mark the start of the segment
201  * @param n2 the node on the way to mark the end of the segment
202  * @return The list of nodes that make the segment
203  */
204  private List<Node> getSegmentFromWay(Node n1, Node n2) {
205    List<Way> w; // way
206    List<Node> s = new ArrayList<>(); // build our segment of Nodes on the Way
207
208    w = n1.getParentWays(); // get parent way
209
210    //what if node has multiple ways? -> we don't do anything
211    if (w.size() > 1) {
212      Logging.warn("makeparallel: start node has multiple parents");
213      return new ArrayList<Node>();
214    }
215
216    if (w.get(0).containsNode(n2) ) { // check selected both nodes are on same way
217
218      List<Node> nw = w.get(0).getNodes(); // get nodes from parent way
219      
220      if (isClosedPath(nw)) {
221        // segment is part of area
222        Logging.warn("makeparallel: segment is from area with " + nw.size() + " nodes");
223        // FIXME area's are screwed up if nw.get(0) is in the middle of selected segment
224        // --> will get detected as reversed way
225      }
226      else {
227        // segment is part of way
228        Logging.warn("makeparallel: segment is from way with " + nw.size() + " nodes");
229      } // else 
230
231        boolean addnodestosegment = false;
232        for (int i = 0; i < nw.size(); i++) {
233          if ( nw.get(i) == n1 ) {
234            addnodestosegment = true;
235          }
236          if ( nw.get(i) == n2 && addnodestosegment == false) {
237            // we encounter endpoint first, way is wrong way around/ or an area with "rootnode" in segment
238            Logging.warn("makeparallel: way is wrong direction, try to reverse"); 
239            new Notification(
240               tr("Way is in wrong direction, try to reverse"))
241               .setIcon(JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE)
242               .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
243               .show();
244             return new ArrayList<Node>();
245          }
246          if ( nw.get(i) == n2 ) {
247            s.add(nw.get(i));
248            addnodestosegment = false;
249          }
250        
251          if (addnodestosegment == true )  {
252            s.add(nw.get(i));
253          }
254        } // for
255
256    }
257    else {
258      Logging.warn("makeparallel: nodes not on same way!!!");
259    }
260
261    return s;
262  } // end getSegmentFromWay()
263
264  /** Calculates the the distance for makeSegmentsParallel 
265  * @param s1 The source segment to make parallel
266  * @param s2 The destination segment to make parallel
267  * @return The distance in the correct direction (hopefully)
268  */
269  private double calculateDistance(List<Node> s1, List<Node> s2) {
270    // Get our distance d
271    double d1 = s1.get(0).getEastNorth().distance( s2.get(0).getEastNorth() );
272
273    double heading_s1 = s1.get(0).getEastNorth().heading(s1.get(1).getEastNorth());
274    double heading_to_s2 = s1.get(0).getEastNorth().heading(s2.get(0).getEastNorth());
275    //Logging.warn("makeparallel: heading_s1=" + heading_s1);
276    //Logging.warn("makeparallel: heading_s2=" + heading_to_s2);
277    
278    int factor;
279    double left =  heading_to_s2 - heading_s1;
280    double right =  heading_s1 - heading_to_s2;
281    if (left < 0)  left  += PI;
282    if (right < 0) right += PI;
283    //Logging.warn("makeparallel: left=" + left);
284    //Logging.warn("makeparallel: right=" + right);
285
286    if (left < right) {
287     factor = -1;
288    }
289    else {
290     factor = 1;
291    }
292
293    //Logging.warn("makeparallel: factor=" + factor);
294    double d = factor * d1;
295    Logging.warn("makeparallel: distance=" + d);
296
297    return d;
298  } // end calculateDistance()
299
300  /** Adds or Removes nodes from the destination segment s2 to match the number of nodes in source s1.
301  * @param s1 The source segment
302  * @param s2 The destination segment
303  * @return true if successful
304  */
305  private boolean addOrRemoveNodesToMatchSegments(List<Node> s1, List<Node> s2) {
306    int diff = s1.size() - s2.size();
307    DataSet ds = OsmDataManager.getInstance().getEditDataSet();
308    List<Command> cmds = new ArrayList<>(); // to store our sequence of commands
309
310    List<Way> w; // way
311    w = s2.get(0).getParentWays(); // get parent way
312    List<Node> nw = w.get(0).getNodes(); // get nodes from parent way
313
314    Logging.warn("makeparallel: s1.size=" + s1.size());
315    Logging.warn("makeparallel: s2.size=" + s2.size());
316    boolean success = true;
317
318    if (diff > 0 && s1.size() > 2 && s2.size() > 2) { // add nodes to s2
319      Logging.warn("makeparallel: adding nodes to s2: " + diff);
320      // find offset
321      int offset = 0;
322      for (int i = 0; i < w.get(0).getNodesCount(); i++) {
323        if (nw.get(i) == s2.get(s2.size()-1)) { // this node on the way matches our previous to last node in segment
324          offset = i; // this is our offset to insert new nodes
325        }  
326      }
327      Logging.warn("makeparallel: adding nodes to s2: offset " + offset);
328      
329      int offset_segment = s2.size() - 1;
330      while (diff > 0) {
331        Node n = new Node();
332        n.setEastNorth(w.get(0).getNode(offset).getEastNorth());
333
334        //ds.addPrimitive(n);            // add new node to dataset
335        cmds.add(new AddCommand(ds, n)); // perform actions undoable
336
337        //w.get(0).addNode(offset, n); // add new node to way
338        nw.add(offset, n);
339        //cmds.add(new ChangeNodesCommand(w.get(0), nw)); // perform actions undoable -> outside whileloop
340
341        s2.add(offset_segment, n);   // add new node to our segment 
342
343        diff--;
344      } // while
345      cmds.add(new ChangeNodesCommand(w.get(0), nw)); // perform actions undoable
346            UndoRedoHandler.getInstance().add(new SequenceCommand("Make Parallel: add nodes", cmds));
347
348    } // if
349    else { // remove nodes from s2
350      if (diff < 0) { 
351        Logging.warn("makeparallel: removing nodes from s2: " + diff);
352
353        // find offset
354        int offset = 0;
355        for (int i = 0; i < w.get(0).getNodesCount(); i++) {
356          if (nw.get(i) == s2.get(s2.size()-1)) { // this node on the way matches our last node in segment
357            offset = i; // this is our offset to delete nodes
358          }  
359        }
360        //Logging.warn("makeparallel: deleting nodes from s2: offset " + offset);
361
362        List<Node> nodes2delete = new ArrayList<>();
363        while (diff < 0) {
364          Node n = w.get(0).getNode(offset);
365          //Logging.warn("makeparallel: deleting nodes from s2: " + n);
366
367          nodes2delete.add(n);
368          if (isSpecialNode(n)) {
369            // check if special tags on node
370            //abort
371            new Notification(
372               tr("This will delete a node with tags or node that belongs to multiple ways. Aborting."))
373               .setIcon(JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE)
374               .setDuration(Notification.TIME_LONG)
375               .show();
376             success = false;
377          } //if 
378          
379          //w.get(0).removeNode(n); // remove node from way
380          nw.remove(offset);
381
382          s2.remove(s2.size()-1);
383
384          //ds.removePrimitive(n);
385          //cmds.add(new DeleteCommand(ds, n)); // perform actions undoable -> outside whileloop
386
387          diff++;
388          offset--;
389        }  // while
390        if (success) {
391          cmds.add(new ChangeNodesCommand(w.get(0), nw)); // perform actions undoable
392          cmds.add(new DeleteCommand(ds, nodes2delete)); // perform actions undoable
393        
394                UndoRedoHandler.getInstance().add(new SequenceCommand("Make Parallel: remove nodes", cmds));
395        }
396      } //  if
397    } // else
398
399    return success;
400
401  } // addOrRemoveNodesToMatchSegments()
402
403
404  /** Move the nodes from segment s2 to be parallel to s1 at distance d.
405  * This is the main function that makes the segments Paralell
406  *
407  * @param s1 containing nodes from source segment
408  * @param s2 containing nodes from destination segment
409  * @param d the distance
410  */
411  private void makeSegmentsParallel (List<Node> s1, List<Node> s2, double d) {
412    List<Command> cmds = new ArrayList<>(); // to store our sequence of commands
413    // Caculations from ParallelWays:
414    // https://josm.openstreetmap.de/browser/josm/trunk/src/org/openstreetmap/josm/actions/mapmode/ParallelWays.java
415
416    if (s1.size() > 2 && s2.size() > 2) { 
417      // Initialize the required parameters. (segment normals, etc.)
418      int nodeCount = s1.size();
419      EastNorth[] pts = new EastNorth[nodeCount];
420      EastNorth[] normals = new EastNorth[nodeCount - 1];
421      int i = 0;
422      for (Node n : s1) {
423          EastNorth t = n.getEastNorth();
424          pts[i] = t;
425          i++;
426      }
427      for (i = 0; i < nodeCount - 1; i++) {
428          double dx = pts[i + 1].getX() - pts[i].getX();
429          double dy = pts[i + 1].getY() - pts[i].getY();
430          double len = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
431          normals[i] = new EastNorth(-dy / len, dx / len);
432      }
433     
434     
435      // This is the core algorithm:
436      /* 1. Calculate a parallel line, offset by 'd', to each segment in the path
437       * 2. Find the intersection of lines belonging to neighboring segments. These become the new node positions
438       * 3. Do some special casing for closed paths
439       *
440       * Simple and probably not even close to optimal performance wise
441       */
442
443
444      EastNorth[] ppts = new EastNorth[nodeCount];
445
446      EastNorth prevA = pts[0].add(normals[0].scale(d));
447      EastNorth prevB = pts[1].add(normals[0].scale(d));
448      for (i = 1; i < nodeCount - 1; i++) {
449          EastNorth a = pts[i].add(normals[i].scale(d));
450          EastNorth b = pts[i + 1].add(normals[i].scale(d));
451          if (Geometry.segmentsParallel(a, b, prevA, prevB)) {
452              ppts[i] = a;
453          } else {
454              ppts[i] = Geometry.getLineLineIntersection(a, b, prevA, prevB);
455          }
456          prevA = a;
457          prevB = b;
458      }
459      if (false /*isClosedPath()*/) { // FIXME we don't expect a closed path
460          EastNorth a = pts[0].add(normals[0].scale(d));
461          EastNorth b = pts[1].add(normals[0].scale(d));
462          if (Geometry.segmentsParallel(a, b, prevA, prevB)) {
463              ppts[0] = a;
464          } else {
465              ppts[0] = Geometry.getLineLineIntersection(a, b, prevA, prevB);
466          }
467          ppts[nodeCount - 1] = ppts[0];
468      } else {
469          ppts[0] = pts[0].add(normals[0].scale(d));
470          ppts[nodeCount - 1] = pts[nodeCount - 1].add(normals[nodeCount - 2].scale(d));
471      }
472
473      for (i = 0; i < nodeCount; i++) {
474          //Logging.warn("makeparallel: moving s2: " + i + "-" + s2.get(i));
475          // s2.get(i).setEastNorth(ppts[i]); // apply the coordinates to the nodes in s2
476          cmds.add(new MoveCommand( s2.get(i), s2.get(i).getEastNorth(), ppts[i] )); // same but with undo
477      }
478    }
479
480    if (!cmds.isEmpty()) {
481            UndoRedoHandler.getInstance().add(new SequenceCommand("Make Parallel: move nodes", cmds));
482    } // if
483    
484  } // end  makeSegmentsParallel()
485
486
487} // end class MakeParallelAction
